title: Ticket #6610: python htcondor.reload_config() does not see environment var changes
description:
Specifically on Windows, the python bindings call htcondor.reload_config() does not see environment variable changes made by the Python program.

Again, this is specific ONLY to Windows. It works on Linux.

Example: 

Note the last line should be 'blah', but it is not
>>> import htcondor
>>> import os
>>> htcondor.param['schedd']
'C:\\condor\\bin\\condor_schedd.exe'
>>> os.environ['_condor_schedd']='blah'
>>> htcondor.reload_config()
>>> htcondor.param['schedd']
'C:\\condor\\bin\\condor_schedd.exe'

This bug is particularly annoying since setting the environment variable CONDOR_CONFIG and then doing a reload_config() call is a common idiom that fails to work on Windows.
remarks:
2018-Mar-15 15:30:38 by tannenba:
The issue here is there are two sets of environment variables on Windows; one maintained by the C runtime library, and another maintained by the Win32 API. Python only modifies the Win32 set, and meanwhile HTCondor's configuration code only looks at the C runtime set. Sigh.

See https://bugs.python.org/issue16633

2018-Mar-19 09:17:26 by johnkn:
CODE_REVIEW env_ptr is checked for null before freeing it, but not before dereferencing it.

2020-Jul-13 12:51:34 by blin:
